query: latest cloud technologies news from aws, azure, and gcp
answer:
Here's a breakdown of the latest cloud technology news from AWS, Azure, and GCP, based on the provided search results:

## Amazon Web Services (AWS)

AWS is seeing significant activity in partnerships, quantum computing, and market share.

*   **SoftServe Launches AWS Partner Business Unit:** SoftServe has established a dedicated Business Unit (BU) specifically for Amazon Web Services (AWS) to accelerate modernization and cloud value for enterprises [1]. This unit aims to help clients move beyond basic cloud migration to achieve complete infrastructure and application modernization, including operational automation and AI integration. The BU utilizes proven frameworks, AWS-native solutions, and specialized AWS-certified consultants and engineers. Key accelerators include SoftServe's Adaptive Modernization Platform (SAMP) and AI-Driven Enhanced Engineering with Q (AIDEEQ). This initiative is designed to shorten modernization timelines from years to months, reduce risk, and deliver tangible results, with clients potentially achieving up to five times faster time-to-market for new features and services and reducing cloud infrastructure costs by up to 30% [1]. The BU focuses on four pillars: igniting innovation at the edge, concentrating on high-impact outcomes, accelerating solution success at scale, and executing with precision and accountability [1]. They leverage AWS-native services such as Transform, Amazon Q, and Bedrock Agents, along with SAMP and AIDEEQ, to reduce modernization timelines by up to 75%, transforming multi-year projects into 4–6-month delivery cycles [1]. SoftServe's AI-powered migration factory further streamlines this process [1]. SoftServe is an AWS Premier Tier Services Partner with 12 AWS competencies and six industry competencies, and is an inaugural launch partner of the AWS Generative AI Competency and Data Foundation for Generative AI with AWS [1]. SoftServe will be attending AWS re:Invent 2025 in Las Vegas, December 1-5, 2025 [1].

*   **APT Quantum Computer Available on AWS Braket:** Alpine Quantum Technologies (AQT) has made its 12-qubit IBEX Q1 trapped-ion quantum computer accessible through Amazon Web Services' (AWS) Braket service [3]. This integration allows customers to reserve time on the quantum system via their AWS accounts [3]. The IBEX Q1 is physically located in Innsbruck, Austria, and is available through the eu-north-1 Region in Stockholm, Sweden, on Tuesdays and Wednesdays from 09:00 to 16:00 UTC [3]. AQT's system is designed to fit into standard 19-inch data center racks, operates at room temperature, and consumes less than 2kW of power [3]. This offering expands the choices for AWS customers experimenting with quantum computing and addresses critical sovereignty needs for EU customers by providing access to locally hosted infrastructure [3]. AWS Braket has previously made quantum computers from providers like IonQ, IQM, Rigetti, and QuEra available [3].

*   **AWS Leads Cloud Market Share:** In Q3 2025, AWS held a leading 29% share of the $107 billion cloud market, despite some erosion [2]. The top three cloud providers, including AWS, Microsoft, and Google, collectively captured 63% of this market [2].

*   **AWS Claims Cloud-Provider First with DWDM Transponder:** AWS has announced a first in the cloud provider space with a DWDM transponder [2].

*   **Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory Partners with AWS:** The Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory is partnering with AWS on an AI troubleshooting system [3].

## Microsoft Azure

Azure's recent developments focus on AI investments, hybrid cloud solutions, and platform enhancements.

*   **Microsoft Invests $5B in Anthropic, Commits $30B to Azure:** Microsoft has announced a significant alliance with Nvidia and Anthropic, which includes a $5 billion investment in Anthropic, the maker of the Claude AI model [6]. Concurrently, Anthropic has committed to spending $30 billion on Azure over several years as part of this new alliance [6]. This move underscores the intensifying competition and strategic partnerships within the AI and cloud computing sectors [6].

*   **Nerdio Announces Support for Azure Virtual Desktop for Hybrid Environments:** Nerdio has introduced support for the newly revealed Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop designed for hybrid environments [4]. This offering aims to assist users of on-premises VDI (Virtual Desktop Infrastructure) in modernizing their setups [4]. Nerdio is an automated end-user computing (EUC) platform that focuses on transforming how organizations deploy and manage Microsoft Cloud technologies [4].

*   **eMazzanti Technologies Offers Complimentary Azure Master Classes:** eMazzanti Technologies, a Microsoft Solution Partner, is providing complimentary 60-minute Azure Master Classes for business leaders [5]. These sessions are intended for those evaluating cloud adoption or seeking to optimize their existing Microsoft Azure environments [5].

*   **Microsoft Foundry Ties in with Agent 365:** Microsoft Foundry has integrated with Agent 365, enhancing its capabilities for developers working on AI agents within Azure [2]. This integration adds context, including model routing, and tightens governance for these development efforts within Azure's broader Agent 365 control plane [2].

*   **Microsoft Ignite 2025:** The latest news and insights regarding Microsoft technologies, including advancements in AI, cloud computing, security, and productivity tools, were announced at the company's annual Microsoft Ignite conference [7].

## Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

While GCP is not directly mentioned with specific new product launches or partnerships in the provided snippets, it is identified as one of the "big three" cloud providers dominating the market.

*   **GCP Captures Significant Cloud Market Share:** Google Cloud is recognized as one of the top three cloud providers that collectively captured 63% of the $107 billion cloud market in Q3 2025 [2]. The company is noted to be rising in market share, driven by AI-driven growth, and holds a significant portion of this market alongside AWS and Microsoft [2].

sources.title: SoftServe Launches AWS Partner Business Unit to Accelerate Modernization and Cloud Value
sources.snippet: SoftServe is an AWS Premier Tier Services Partner with 12 AWS competencies and six industry competencies spanning financial services, healthcare, energy/oil & gas, retail, and manufacturing/industrial ...

sources.title: AWS claims cloud-provider first with DWDM transponder
sources.snippet: IT and cloud giant reveals in-house development project for dense wavelength division multiplexing transponder system showing significant bandwidth gains, and reduced failure rates and power consumption.

sources.title: APT quantum computer launches on AWS Braket
sources.snippet: Braket launched in the US in 2020, and was initially available from AWS' Virginia, California, and Oregon regions. The quantum systems are not housed in AWS data centers; instead, they are hosted by their respective providers and connect to AWS’ cloud via APIs.

sources.title: Nerdio announces support for Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop for hybrid environments to help on-premises VDI users modernize
sources.snippet: Chicago, IL, Nov. 18, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Nerdio, the automated end-user computing (EUC) platform transforming how organizations deploy and manage Microsoft Cloud technologies, today announced support for the newly revealed Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop for hybrid environments.

sources.title: eMazzanti Technologies Offers Complimentary Azure Master Classes for Business Leaders
sources.snippet: Mazzanti Technologies, a leading Managed Services Provider and Microsoft Solution Partner with more than 20 years of customer success, is pleased to announce a series of complimentary 60-minute Azure Master Classes for business leaders evaluating cloud adoption or seeking to optimize their existing Microsoft Azure environments.

sources.title: Microsoft to invest $5B in Anthropic, as Claude maker commits $30B to Azure in new Nvidia alliance
sources.snippet: The frenzy of AI deals and cloud partnerships reached another zenith Tuesday morning as Microsoft, Nvidia, and Anthropic announced a surprise alliance that includes a $5 billion investment by Microsoft in Anthropic — which,

sources.title: Microsoft Ignite 2025 — get the latest news and insights
sources.snippet: Learn about the latest Microsoft technologies, including AI, cloud computing, security, and productivity tools, announced at the company's annual Ignite conference.

sources.title: Microsoft expands Azure Local offering, adds Nvidia servers for sovereign AI
sources.snippet: In a blog post penned by Microsoft's president and CTO of Microsoft Specialized Clouds, Douglas Phillips, the company has revealed that Azure Local can now be scaled to support hundreds of servers, and has a new sovereign AI capability through a partnership with Nvidia.

sources.title: EPAM Wins the 2025 Microsoft Innovate with Azure AI Platform Partner of the Year Award
sources.snippet: EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) today announced it has won the Innovate with Azure AI Platform 2025 Microsoft Partner of the Year Award. The Company was honored among a global field of top Microsoft partners for demonstrating excellence in the innovation and implementation of customer solutions based on Microsoft technology.

sources.title: Google Announces Its Own Version of Apple's Private Cloud Compute
sources.snippet: Google this week announced Private AI Compute, a new cloud-based system designed to deliver AI capabilities using its Gemini models while maintaining strict data privacy controls, a framework that closely parallels Apple's own Private Cloud Compute technology.
